Internal custom page


An internal custom page (written in HTML and/or JavaScript) may be imported under a given /Custom/ ODB key. The name of this key will appear in the Main Status page as an alias-links (or alias-button - Dec 2009). By clicking on this link/button, the contents of this key is interpreted as html content.

The insertion of a new Custom page requires the following steps:

  • Create an initial html file using your favorite HTML editor (see How to create a custom page)
  • Import this file
Note:
  • Once the file is imported into ODB, you can ONLY edit it through the web (as long as mhttpd is active) by clicking on the ODB(button) ... Custom(Key) ... Edit (Hyperlink at the bottom of the key).
  • The Custom page can also be exported back to a ASCII file using the odbedit command export, e.g. 
      [local:midas:Stopped]/>cd Custom/
  [local:midas:Stopped]/Custom>export test&
  File name: mcustom.html
  [local:midas:Stopped]/Custom>

Figure 1 shows an internal custom page which has been imported into the ODB at key /Custom/Overview& as shown in Figure 2.




Figure 1 : Internal custom web page with history graph.








Figure 2 : Internal custom web page loaded into the ODB.
